business.headline: India may finalise interim trade deal with US this week: ReportBoth sides are racing to complete the deal before July 9, when the US is set to impose a 26% reciprocal tariff on Indian goods. These tariffs were first announced by President Donald Trump in April and temporarily suspended for 90 days.

Digital India turns 10, PM Modi says it's become a people's movementIn the blog titled 'A Decade of Digital India', on LinkedIn, PM Modi said the Digital India initiative is no longer just a government programme but a 'people's movement.'
Why India's ultra-rich love family officesForget yachts. For India's ultra-rich, the ultimate power move is a family office. Read on to see why it's becoming the new gold standard of wealth.

New York tops billionaire list. Which Indian city made it to the top 10?Globally, nearly a quarter of the world's 3,028 billionaires live in just 10 cities across six countries. These cities continue to attract wealth due to strong business ecosystems, investor-friendly policies, and thriving industries.
Sensex opens flat, Nifty above 25,500; Asian Paints up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 186.04 points to 83,792.50, while the NSE Nifty50 added 56.35 points to 25,573.40 as of 9:28 am.

SBI turns 70: Why bank's blue keyhole has stood the test of timeAfter independence, under the first 5-year plan's push for rural development, the government nationalised the Imperial Bank. On July 1, 1955, the State Bank of India was born under the State Bank of India Act.

MS Dhoni files for trademark of iconic nickname 'Captain Cool'Over the years, 'Captain Cool' has meant much more than just a catchy title. It sums up Dhoni's calm mind under pressure, from winning India's first T20 World Cup in 2007 to lifting the ODI World Cup in 2011 and the Champions Trophy in 2013.
Sensex ends 450 points lower, Nifty below 25,600; Trent gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex fell 452.44 points to close at 83,606.46, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 120.75 points, ending below the 25,600 mark.

Look rich or be rich: Startup founder on middle class dilemmaToday, many people in the middle class are busy trying to look rich, rather than actually becoming rich. Costly gadgets, fancy brunches and trendy holidays are often paid for with loans and EMIs, says founder and CEO, Shyam Achuthan.

8 years of GST: Top 5 achievements you should knowSince its launch, GST has strengthened India's revenue and expanded the taxpayer base, with collections reaching a record Rs 22.08 lakh crore in 2024–25, as per PIB.

IndusInd Bank submits CEO shortlist to RBI after leadership exits: ReportThe candidates include Rajiv Anand, Rahul Shukla, and Anup Saha — all experienced financial sector leaders. The move comes after the abrupt exits of CEO Sumant Kathpalia and deputy Arun Khurana in April, following a $230 million hit from years of misaccounting in internal derivative trades.

Rural India holds steady as urban consumption slows, finds Equirus SecuritiesThe mood remains subdued overall, but analysts note an undercurrent of recovery in rural pockets, led by fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG), electric mobility and segments of real estate.

entertainment.headline: Director Tharun Bhascker announces Ee Nagaraniki Emaindi sequel with original castSeven years after the cult favourite hit theatres, the makers have announced a sequel to 'Ee Nagaraniki Emaindi'. Titled 'ENE Repeat', the film promises to bring back the original gang, this time in a new setting and even more chaos.

Vidya Balan, Rekha share a hug at Umrao Jaan screening, Shabana Azmi joins. WatchVidya Balan and Shaban Azmi joined Rekha at the 'Umrao Jaan' screening in Mumbai. A viral video featured memorable moments between the three stars.

Sonakshi Sinha criticises paparazzi intrusion: Can't even go to a funeralSonakshi Sinha criticised the growing paparazzi culture, saying it's wrong to click photos at funerals. She also spoke about being body-shamed in the film industry and how she tried to promote a healthy body image.

Madhoo on saying no to film with Big B, quitting Bollywood: Became sad going to setsActor Madhoo recently spoke about rejecting a film with Amitabh Bachchan and moving to South film industry after her Bollywood stint. She reflected on feeling discontent with her work in Hindi film industry as an artist.

Anupam Kher on love and desire: These days, women can be dangerous to husbandsVeteran actor Anupam Kher, in an exclusive interview with India Today, opened up about the shifting nature of relationships and passion in today's world. He highlighted that love and desire transcend age and geographical boundaries.

Shefali Jariwala's friend Pooja Ghai recalls her final moments: Pulse was still onPooja Ghai, a close friend of Shefali Jariwala, has spoken about the actor's final moments before her untimely death. She shed light on the medical care involving IV drips and mentions Parag Tyagi's role during this difficult time.

Konkana Sen Sharma discusses motherhood penalty, fatherhood premium in BollywoodActor Konkona Sen Sharma recently opened up on the challenges faced by working mothers. While reflecting on gender discrimination, she stated that there is a fatherhood premium in the Indian film industry.

The Devil Wears Prada 2: Meryl Streep, Emily Blunt, Anne Hathaway begin filmingThe iconic trio Meryl Streep, Emily Blunt and Anne Hathaway have started filming for 'The Devil Wears Prada 2'. Fans eagerly await the sequel to the beloved fashion drama.

SRK praises Tanvi The Great trailer, applauds Anupam Kher for always taking chancesActor Shah Rukh Khan extended his wishes to Anupam Kher for his upcoming directorial, 'Tanvi The Great'. Kher has written and produced the film.

Smriti Irani opens up on Kyunki Saas… delay: Got a call from PM's officeSmriti Irani has revealed the secretive and delayed journey of the reboot of the iconic show 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi'. The much-awaited return faces further delays as the makers strive for perfection to honour the show's legacy for a new generation of viewers.

Heads of State review: Priyanka, John Cena, Idris Elba pack punches and punchlinesReleased-Wed Jul 02, 2025Heads of State movie review: 'Heads of State' is an engaging action comedy blending humour, emotion, and intense sequences. John Cena, Priyanka Chopra and Idris Elba lead a star-studded cast in a thrilling mission.

Kannappa box office Day 4: Vishnu Manchu's film faces disappointing Monday in IndiaActor Vishnu Manchu's 'Kannappa' had a disappointing Monday at the box office in India. The film saw a massive dip in numbers, but managed to rake in Rs 25 crore in four days in the country.

Ranbir Kapoor gets emotional as he wraps Nitesh Tiwari's RamayanaBollywood's much-anticipated film 'Ramayana', directed by Nitesh Tiwari and featuring Ranbir Kapoor and Sai Pallavi, has been wrapped. Ranbir addressed the cast and crew with a heartfelt speech.

Filmmaker Ashoke Pandit condemns Naseeruddin Shah's support for Diljit DosanjhFilmmaker Ashoke Pandit, in a recent interview, said that he was not surprised or shocked to see Naseerudddin Shah supporting Diljit Dosanjh amid 'Sardaar Ji 3' controversy. The casting of Pakistani actor Hania Aamir caused a widespread backlash against the singer-actor and the team.

Held puja, observed fast, took anti-ageing drugs: Shefali Jariwala's last hoursActor Shefali Jariwala, of 'Kaanta Laga' fame, died on June 27. Here's a detailed report about the sequence of events, as confirmed by police sources.

Actor Saanvika refused kissing scene in Panchayat 4, says script was changedActor Saanvika, who plays Rinki in 'Panchayat', shared that she declined a kissing scene in Season 4 due to discomfort and the show's family-friendly appeal. The makers respected her decision and replaced the scene, maintaining the essence of her character without compromising her comfort.

Ram Kapoor denies losing weight to get more work, says my name is not KhanActor Ram Kapoor recently shared that he did not lose weight to get more work offers. He was in a conversation with filmmaker Farah Khan for her YouTube channel.

Kareena shares her parents Babita-Randhir's decision to reunite after years apartKareena Kapoor expressed happiness at the decision of her parents, Randhir Kapoor and Babita, to spend their later years together. She said this reunion marks a full-circle moment for her and her sister Karisma.
Project Hail Mary trailer: Ryan Gosling is on a space mission to save the worldThe trailer of 'Project Hail Mary' starring Ryan Gosling is out. The film will release in India on March 20, 2026.

general news.headline: May have to close shop, return home: Trump fires back at Elon Musk over tax billThe US President's fiery post came as Elon Musk renewed his criticism of Trump's 'Big, Beautiful bill' and promised to launch a new political outfit if it was passed.

35 dead in Telangana pharma plant blast, bodies were pulled out of debrisThe death toll due to a reactor explosion at a chemical manufacturing plant in Telangana's Sangareddy district rose to 35. Rescue is ongoing, and a government inquiry has been ordered.

Iran set to buy Chinese J-10C fighter jets after Israeli drubbingIran is reportedly turning to China's J-10C fighter jets after its air force was left grounded during Israeli and American airstrikes. It exposed sanction-battered Tehran's ageing fleet. The move to procure the same Chengdu J-10C jets, which are compatible with the PL-15 missiles which Pakistan recently used against India, follows delays in Russia's delivery of Su-35s.

Held puja, observed fast, took anti-ageing drugs: Shefali Jariwala's last hoursActor Shefali Jariwala, of 'Kaanta Laga' fame, died on June 27. Here's a detailed report about the sequence of events, as confirmed by police sources.
Why India's ultra-rich love family officesForget yachts. For India's ultra-rich, the ultimate power move is a family office. Read on to see why it's becoming the new gold standard of wealth.

Delhi-Vienna Air India flight plunged 900 feet post take-off, pilots groundedJust days after a deadly crash in Ahmedabad, an Air India Delhi-Vienna flight dropped 900 feet mid-air, triggering warnings. Pilots have been grounded as the aviation watchdog is probing maintenance lapses and safety compliance.

Narayana Murthy asked Indians to work 70 hrs, now Infosys tells staff no overtimeInfosys has reportedly started an internal campaign urging employees to maintain work-life balance. The company is urging employees to limit overtime, especially during remote work. This

Fear in POK village as grooming gang leader faces deportation from UKConvicted grooming gang leader Abdul Rauf, living in Rochdale, UK, is building a house in his native village in Charhoi in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (POK). Neighbours fear for their children's safety as the convicted sex offender walks freely without serving his full sentence. Though Rauf is fighting deportation, claiming he is stateless, the construction in POK village states otherwise.

US politician's Indian-origin wife defends his 'uncivilised' remark on Zohran's videoIt began after a video of New York City mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani eating rice with his hands while speaking during an interview went viral on X.

Thai court suspends PM from duty over leaked call with ex-Cambodian leaderPrime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra has faced growing dissatisfaction over her handling of the latest border dispute with Cambodia, involving an armed confrontation on May 28 in which one Cambodian soldier was killed. The leaked phone call while she engaged in diplomacy over the border dispute set off a string of complaints and public protests.

Shux studying muscle loss in space as Ax-4 cruises smoothlyGroup Captain Shubhanshu Shukla's ISS mission marks India's first in-orbit biomedical research effort, studying muscle loss, remote health AI, and brain-computer interfaces under the privately operated Axiom-4 spaceflight.

Bhopal man kills live-in partner, hides body; confesses to friend while highIn Bhopal, a man strangled his live-in partner during a fight and later confessed the murder while drinking with a friend. Police arrested him and recovered the decomposing body from their rented home.

Smriti Irani opens up on Kyunki Saas… delay: Got a call from PM's officeSmriti Irani has revealed the secretive and delayed journey of the reboot of the iconic show 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi'. The much-awaited return faces further delays as the makers strive for perfection to honour the show's legacy for a new generation of viewers.

BJP picks new state chiefs, moves closer to electing JP Nadda's successorThe BJP's constitution requires the election of its presidents in at least 19 out of its 37 organisational states before the process to elect its national president begins, and the ruling party is set to cross the threshold on Tuesday.

Vendetta Republic: Minorities, women, justice under siege in Yunus's BangladeshIn Bangladesh, crimes against women seem to be on the rise at a time when Islamist radicals, who strongly back the Yunus regime, have taken to the streets to oppose women's rights. But the Yunus administration is in persistent denial.

PAN-Aadhaar rule and new bank charges take effect from todayStarting today, Indian taxpayers and customers of major banks like SBI, HDFC, and ICICI will see important changes.
From Aadhaar-PAN linking to new credit card charges, here's what to know.

Heads of State review: Priyanka, John Cena, Idris Elba pack punches and punchlinesReleased-Wed Jul 02, 2025Heads of State movie review: 'Heads of State' is an engaging action comedy blending humour, emotion, and intense sequences. John Cena, Priyanka Chopra and Idris Elba lead a star-studded cast in a thrilling mission.

Bored of winning, para-javelin star Sumit Antil tests limits in able-bodied meetsTwo-time Paralympic gold medallist Sumit Antil, in conversation with India Today, spoke about competing in able-bodied events and his ultimate goal of breaching the 80m mark. The world record holder has begun preparation for the World Para Athletics Championships in September-October.

New York tops billionaire list. Which Indian city made it to the top 10?Globally, nearly a quarter of the world's 3,028 billionaires live in just 10 cities across six countries. These cities continue to attract wealth due to strong business ecosystems, investor-friendly policies, and thriving industries.

Tribunal orders reinstatement of Bengaluru cop suspended after stampede deathsThe Central Administrative Tribunal has ordered the reinstatement of IPS officer Vikash Kumar, suspended after the June 4 stampede in Bengaluru. The Karnataka government is likely to challenge the decision.

Viral video of people bathing in Delhi's Sunder Nursery pond sparks outrageThe viral video, posted by Instagram user Ayyan Javed, shows several visitors bathing and swimming in the ornamental pond at Sunder Nursery.

India's Agni-5 'bunker buster' missile to carry largest conventional warheadThe Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) is developing a modified version of the Agni-5 intercontinental ballistic missile. The new variant will be a conventional weapon capable of carrying a massive 7500-kilogram bunker-buster warhead.

Girl falls from Disney cruise's 4th deck, father jumps overboard to save herA father jumped into the ocean to save his daughter after she fell overboard from the fourth deck of the Disney Dream cruise ship on June 29. The crew rescued them after more than 10 minutes in the water. Passengers praised the father's bravery.

Petrol, diesel ban on old vehicles in Delhi starts today, 350 booths under watchCompliance with rules is mandatory for fuel stations in the national capital, which are also required to train their personnel accordingly. This move was initiated by the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) in a bid to curb air pollution in the national capital.

Director Tharun Bhascker announces Ee Nagaraniki Emaindi sequel with original castSeven years after the cult favourite hit theatres, the makers have announced a sequel to 'Ee Nagaraniki Emaindi'. Titled 'ENE Repeat', the film promises to bring back the original gang, this time in a new setting and even more chaos.

Vidya Balan, Rekha share a hug at Umrao Jaan screening, Shabana Azmi joins. WatchVidya Balan and Shaban Azmi joined Rekha at the 'Umrao Jaan' screening in Mumbai. A viral video featured memorable moments between the three stars.

Sonakshi Sinha criticises paparazzi intrusion: Can't even go to a funeralSonakshi Sinha criticised the growing paparazzi culture, saying it's wrong to click photos at funerals. She also spoke about being body-shamed in the film industry and how she tried to promote a healthy body image.

Madhoo on saying no to film with Big B, quitting Bollywood: Became sad going to setsActor Madhoo recently spoke about rejecting a film with Amitabh Bachchan and moving to South film industry after her Bollywood stint. She reflected on feeling discontent with her work in Hindi film industry as an artist.

sports.headline: Alcaraz felt Centre Court nerves after 1st round scare: Was struggling a bitCarlos Alcaraz highlighted that the weight of the occasion got to him during the first-round clash against Fabio Fognini which may have been a bit too close for comfort for the two-time champion.

Why Yashasvi Jaiswal was relieved of slip duties ahead of Edgbaston TestEngland vs India: During India's intense fielding drills on Monday in Birmingham, young opener Yashasvi Jaiswal was a notable absentee in the slip cordon and in the gully region. The opener dropped as many as four catches in the first Test that India lost by five wickets.

Bored of winning, para-javelin star Sumit Antil tests limits in able-bodied meetsTwo-time Paralympic gold medallist Sumit Antil, in conversation with India Today, spoke about competing in able-bodied events and his ultimate goal of breaching the 80m mark. The world record holder has begun preparation for the World Para Athletics Championships in September-October.

Club World Cup: Al-Hilal stun Manchester City, Inter Milan crash outEuropean football took a beating as Manchester City were shockingly beaten by Al-Hilal in the FIFA Club World Cup round of 16 stage while Champions League finalists, Inter Milan also crashed out after being defeated by Fluminense.

Day 2 schedule: Novak Djokovic, Jannik Sinner and Iga Swiatek eye strong startsWimbledon: Novak Djokovic, Jannik Sinner and Iga Swiatek begin their Wimbledon 2025 campaigns on Tuesday in London. After a dramatic opening day, the top seeds will be hoping for smoother sailings.

Nathan Lyon quits iconic Australian role after 12 years, opens up on retirementNathan Lyon has stepped down as the Australian cricket team's songmaster after 12 years. The off-spinner remains focused doing well for the Test team, signalling his intentions to play in India and England in 2027.

Yashasvi Jaiswal's Goa U-turn complete, opener to continue playing for MumbaiWhile Prithvi Shaw appears set to depart Mumbai ahead of the 2025–26 season, Yashasvi Jaiswal will continue to represent the domestic cricket heavyweights. The MCA has approved his request to revoke the previously issued NOC for a move to Goa.

Sinner looks to bury Roland Garros demons in bid for 1st Wimbledon titleWimbledon 2025: Can Jannik Sinner recover from the heartbreak of the French Open? The World No. 1 heads into Wimbledon under a bit of pressure. After an early exit in Halle, his warm-up event for the grass-court Grand Slam, Sinner faces a tough test as he searches for his maiden crown in London.

Is Ravindra Jadeja, the all-rounder, a no-show in SENA Tests?Ravindra Jadeja, once part of a lethal spin duo with R Ashwin, struggled to make an impact in the Headingley Test. For all his match-winning feats at home and in the subcontinent, his effectiveness as a game-changer has faded in South Africa, England, New Zealand, Australia (SENA) conditions.

Brett Lee's humble response to Neeraj Chopra's Javelin call: Nowhere closeBrett Lee humbly responded to Neeraj Chopra's javelin thrower comment, saying he tried it in school but is nowhere near Neeraj's level, and wishes the Olympic champion all the best.

Alcaraz survives Fognini scare, Rune stunned, Raducanu marches aheadWimbledon 2025: Defending champion Carlos Alcaraz battled past Italian Fabio Fognini to claim a 7-5, 6-7(5), 7-5, 2-6, 6-1 win. American sixth seed Madison Keys overcame Romania's Elena-Gabriela Ruse, rallying from a set down to earn a hard-fought 6-7(4), 7-5, 7-5 victory. Chile's Nicolás Jarry stunned Danish eighth seed Holger Rune 4-6, 4-6, 7-5, 6-3, 6-4 in a match lasting over three and a half hours.

Yashasvi Jaiswal's Goa U-turn complete, opener to continue playing for MumbaiWhile Prithvi Shaw appears set to depart Mumbai ahead of the 2025–26 season, Yashasvi Jaiswal will continue to represent the domestic cricket heavyweights. The MCA has approved his request to revoke the previously issued NOC for a move to Goa.

Sinner looks to bury Roland Garros demons in bid for 1st Wimbledon titleWimbledon 2025: Can Jannik Sinner recover from the heartbreak of the French Open? The World No. 1 heads into Wimbledon under a bit of pressure. After an early exit in Halle, his warm-up event for the grass-court Grand Slam, Sinner faces a tough test as he searches for his maiden crown in London.

Is Ravindra Jadeja, the all-rounder, a no-show in SENA Tests?Ravindra Jadeja, once part of a lethal spin duo with R Ashwin, struggled to make an impact in the Headingley Test. For all his match-winning feats at home and in the subcontinent, his effectiveness as a game-changer has faded in South Africa, England, New Zealand, Australia (SENA) conditions.

Brett Lee's humble response to Neeraj Chopra's Javelin call: Nowhere closeBrett Lee humbly responded to Neeraj Chopra's javelin thrower comment, saying he tried it in school but is nowhere near Neeraj's level, and wishes the Olympic champion all the best.

Alcaraz survives Fognini scare, Rune stunned, Raducanu marches aheadWimbledon 2025: Defending champion Carlos Alcaraz battled past Italian Fabio Fognini to claim a 7-5, 6-7(5), 7-5, 2-6, 6-1 win. American sixth seed Madison Keys overcame Romania's Elena-Gabriela Ruse, rallying from a set down to earn a hard-fought 6-7(4), 7-5, 7-5 victory. Chile's Nicolás Jarry stunned Danish eighth seed Holger Rune 4-6, 4-6, 7-5, 6-3, 6-4 in a match lasting over three and a half hours.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
